title: Red Sox have reportedly discussed trading reliever Jordan Hicks in search of an infielder
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: The Red Sox are discussing trades involving reliever Jordan Hicks to acquire an infielder, according to reports.
Boston starters Brayan Bello and Patrick Sandoval are also mentioned in trade talks for potential infield upgrades.
Possible infield targets include Cubs' Nico Hoerner and Astros' Isaac Paredes, with free agent Eugenio Suarez considered.

title: Breakout Patriots LB K’Lavon Chaisson wants to re-sign with New England in free agency
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: K'Lavon Chaisson, a Patriots linebacker, aims to re-sign with New England after a standout season as a defensive force.
Chaisson recorded 7.5 sacks, 18 QB hits, and two forced fumbles in the 2025 regular season with the Patriots.
Praised team coordinators for his growth, Chaisson is focused on winning Super Bowl LX with New England.

title: Patriots DC Terrell Williams declared cancer-free after four months battling prostate cancer
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams was declared cancer-free earlier this month, after battling prostate cancer since September.
Williams, 51, underwent five rounds of chemotherapy and his successful treatment allows him to travel for Super Bowl LX.
Head coach Mike Vrabel announced the good news before the Patriots' divisional round victory against the Texans.

title: Cambridge becomes first Mass. city to endorse Plant Based Treaty — but what does that mean?
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Cambridge City Council endorses Plant Based Treaty, becoming first Massachusetts city to support the initiative.
Endorsement aims to reduce emissions, enhance health, and promote sustainability through plant-based diet awareness.
Cambridge joins Providence and Boston as cities targeted for treaty endorsement to complement climate action plans.

title: 5 Catherine O’Hara movies and TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Catherine O'Hara, acclaimed actress from 'Schitt's Creek' and 'Home Alone,' died at 71 following a brief illness.
"A Mighty Wind" and "Beetlejuice Beetlejuice" showcase O'Hara's roles; both are available on YouTube and HBO Max respectively.
'Schitt's Creek' and 'The Studio' highlight O'Hara's TV work, streaming on Hulu, Prime Video, and Apple TV.

title: Mike Vrabel doesn’t buy that Patriots’ white uniforms provide good luck: ‘Hope the tooth fairy comes tonight’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel dismisses the idea that uniform colors bring good luck for Super Bowl LX.
Patriots are 5-0 in white jerseys this season, and historical stats show a 37-22 Super Bowl record for white uniforms.
Seahawks are also 6-0 in navy jerseys this season, presenting a uniform color clash for Super Bowl LX.

title: Dave Epstein on how this Atlantic winter storm will impact Mass. — and how it largely won’t
author: David Epstein
bullets: Cape Cod and islands are expected to see 3 to 6 inches of snow from an Atlantic winter storm.
Boston and nearby areas may receive only a coating to 1 inch of snow, with minimal impact expected.
Possible coastal flooding Sunday into Monday along Eastern Mass. coastlines due to strong winds and high tides.

title: Celtics reportedly unlikely to take ‘huge swings’ ahead of NBA trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to pursuit top stars like Giannis Antetokounmpo or Jaren Jackson Jr. before Feb. 5 trade deadline.
Boston is exploring trades for a center, possibly involving guard Anfernee Simons who is in the final year of his contract.
The team is constrained by financial limits, sitting less than $8 million below the second salary cap apron.

title: These 5 Boston restaurants received all-alcohol licenses under new legislation
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston Licensing Board approved five restaurants to upgrade beer-and-wine licenses to all-alcohol licenses.
Restaurants 89 Charles, Bebop, Carmelina’s, New England Wicked Craft Company, and Serafina received all-alcohol licenses.
The license upgrade is part of 2026 Massachusetts State Budget allowing beer-and-wine licenses to serve spirits.

title: Entangled right whale found dead off North Carolina coast
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A 4-year-old North Atlantic right whale named Division was found dead off North Carolina, entangled in fishing gear.
Division had been spotted entangled multiple times since December 2025, with worsening injuries from the fishing line.
This incident marks the first detected North Atlantic right whale fatality since May 2024, NOAA says.
